name: UPCASE FIELD
description: This will change all or some subset of all the characters in an A type field to upper case.

parameters.name: fieldname
parameters.description: The name of the field to be changed to upper case.

parameters.name: ALL
parameters.description: If this option is included in the command line then all of the characters in the field will be changed to upper case. If it is not specified then only those characters not surrounded by quote marks (single or double) will be changed to upper case.

comments: When you use the function UP() the program puts the ‘upcased’ field in the temporary data space. If you are trying to UP a field that is larger than that space you will get the message that the program is out of room in the temporary data area. This command is provided to you so that you can UP a field larger than the temporary data area within its own space. Using this command you will not run out of memory.
